page.title: 04THE TIBETAN MONASTRY
page.content: Set in forty five acres of woods and fields , in a landscaped garden where prayer_flags flutter,peacocks strut,swans glide on a lake of waterlillies, and maroon_robed monks walk quietly , the building is in striking contrast to the grey stone houses of the valley. The exterior is painted in bright primary colours, the interior walls covered with exquisite religious paintings and murals known as{thangkas},the work of the resident artist Sherapalden Beru who is now transferring his knowledge to six western students committed to long term study of at least seven years.
